channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump says 'new category' of crime under Biden-Harris administration is 'beyond control'
item.description: Former President Trump told an Asheville, North Carolina, crowd on Wednesday that the Biden-Harris administration is responsible for a new crime that is "beyond control" called "migrant crime."

item.title: Walz agrees to VP debate Oct. 1, hosted by CBS News; Vance noncommittal
item.description: Democratic nominee Tim Walz agreed Wednesday to a date for a vice-presidential debate hosted by CBS News.

item.title: Injecting Politics into Vaccines
item.description: Political interference in scientific agencies, however benign the motivation, undermines public confidence in health policies.

item.title: Is AI Jesus A Helpful Tool Or A Digital Antichrist?
item.description: With the rise of deepfakes and biased AI, there’s never been a more ominous time for Christians to merge their theology with technology.

item.title: Harris dodging flip-flop attacks as faceless surrogates flip on key positions: 'Playing politics'
item.description: Campaign officials for Vice President Harris have been the ones to announce her new stance on key issues she opposed during her 2019 presidential campaign.

item.title: State Fair of Texas bans guns, drawing threats of legal action from AG Ken Paxton
item.description: The State Fair of Texas is laying down a new rule before millions of visitors flock through the gates for corn dogs, deep-fried delights and a friendly wave from a five-story cowboy named Big Tex: No guns allowed.

item.title: Degas and Impressionism: A Thorny Artist Makes for a Quirky Show
item.description: For Impressionism’s 150th anniversary, the Clark Art Institute probes an outsized artist’s cryptic impact.

item.title: Jury Finds Portland Antifa Leader Guilty, Police Arrest Member For Assault
item.description: A jury in Clackamas County, Oregon, convicted Antifa leader Alissa Azar. Then an Antifa member attacked a man outside the courthouse.

item.title: Climate justice group that trains federal judges accused of 'corruptly influencing courts'
item.description: A new report by an American energy advocacy group is warning about a legal training program that it says is “corruptly influencing the courts and destroying the rule of law."

item.title: Delegate who was arrested at Ferguson protest withdraws from Democratic National Convention
item.description: One of the people accused of damaging a Ferguson Police Department fence moments before a police officer was critically injured has withdrawn as an uncommitted alternate delegate to the Democratic National Convention, the Missouri Democratic Party said Wednesday.

item.title: Big Pharma Is about to Make a Lot of Money, and That’s Good
item.description: Even though drug companies make products that better our lives, they’re subject to right-wing conspiracy theories and left-wing economic jealousy.

item.title: States File Federal Lawsuit Seeking To Shut Down ‘Bidenbucks’
item.description: Biden's executive order is using federal agencies to register and mobilize left-leaning voters ahead of the 2024 election.

item.title: DOJ suddenly located Biden biographer transcripts created by Robert Hur: watchdog
Big Georgia county to start charging some costs to people who challenge eligibility of voters
item.description: An election board in one of Georgia's largest counties has voted to start charging people who challenge the eligibility of voters for the cost of notifying the challenged voters.

item.title: Sorry, Secretary Cardona, but Rule by Experts Is Not Democracy in Education
item.description: Overzealous defenders of the public-education establishment have lamented the increasing pushback from the political center and right. They’re wrong to do so.

item.title: Federal Civil Rights Complaint Accuses Cleveland Clinic Of Racial Discrimination
item.description: The complaint, which alleges the Cleveland Clinic excludes white patients in favor of minorities, may trigger a federal investigation.

item.title: Senate Dem in key battleground race flip-flopped on student debt under Biden: No 'magic wand'
item.description: Longtime Senate Democrat Bob Casey has flip-flopped on student debt forgiveness, with unearthed video showing he did not support debt forgiveness in 2014.

item.title: Colorado Capitol rolls back ban on political swag after kicking out pro-lifer over sweatshirt
item.description: Visitors to the Colorado State Capitol will no longer be monitored by the political fashion police.

item.title: Tim Walz’s Faulty Case against Gun Rights
item.description: Left unaddressed in the controversy over Walz’s military service is the suggestion that our soldiers carry special ‘weapons of war’ that civilians at home can easily buy.

item.title: Media Claim Inflation ‘Slowing’ Even Though Prices Have Only Skyrocketed Under Biden-Harris
item.description: Basic goods and services cost at least 20 percent more now than they first did when Biden and Harris first entered the White House.
